synthesis_conditions.drying_method: heated under vacuum at 85°C for 12 h
synthesis_conditions.additional_information: The synthesis affords a white crystalline material. The basic unit of oCB-MOF-1 is a tetranuclear Zn4(O)2(OOC)4 cluster.

Heating oCB-MOF-1 at 200°C for 12 h removes all six DMF molecules, but PXRD analysis showed a loss of crystallinity and CO2 sorption measurements revealed a decrease of 35% of the BET area compared to that of oCB-MOF-1.

chemical_treatment.conditions: 10 equivalents of NaOH in DMF for 1 h at room temperature
immersion in H2O (pH < 6.5) for 1 h at room temperature

synthesis_conditions.additional_information: The switch from hydrophobic (contact angle = 140° for hand-packed; 108° for the pellet) to superhydrophilic (contact angle = 0°) upon immersion in NaOH/DMF solution is reversible. The initial hydrophobicity is fully recovered when hydrophilic oCB-MOF-1 is immersed in H2O.
